pros: I absolutely love my job at Mainehealth
cons: No cons, this is the best place I’ve worked with many perks.

review_title: Good starting pay, Great Co-workers, Satisfying Work
pros: The starting pay was appealing and my department had rotating weekends off. For me, working at my own accord with out anyone telling me to do this and do that all the time was a welcome change from retail; but of course that doesn't mean you can go as slow as you like. It is a fast paced job. My co-workers were helpful and great to talk to. The nurses and doctors were always appreciative of our help. I was only there for about 6 months, but that was just because I moved out of state in 2023. Helping out with helicopter landings felt like a bonus to me. If I return to the area, they are the first on my list for a job.
cons: -Short staffed, but I found it to be not overwhelming. -It's not a place for people who are scared about getting sick in the hospital, but we used protective equipment when we worked in rooms with precautionary signs. Hand sanitizer dispensers are mounted everywhere. And people there who have worked Housekeeping for years haven't tracked a sickness from work.

review_title: Certainly the worst place I've ever worked
pros: Not many. Generally the workers are reasonable, I'd say. Some people try and work hard, but they are about 30% of the population at MaineHealth.
cons: Terrible management in the "IT" areas of the place. They treat their network as if it's some secondary thing. There is no hospital without a well functioning network. The clowns that have installed themselves in this dept are just that. If you're thinking applying for job a MH, please do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. I guess my attitude about the whole MaineHealth operation is not helped by the fact that they misdiagnosed a major health issue for me while the assigned Dr. was out playing golf and they handed me off from Dr. to Dr. to Dr. Finally one of them figured out what was wrong months later. I never should have started working for them in first place, but I did, and it was a big mistake. Place is awful and you will not be happy unless you're just looking to do the minimum, collect a check. Definitely the worst place I've ever worked as an adult.

job_title: Tier 2 Technical Support in Portland, ME
pros: Personal time off is great.
cons: Advancement is slow and you need a lot more education to do so.

pros: Pay is ok, convenient location, access to free parking
cons: Extremely understaffed, overbooked for appointments, patients complaining often (and with reason). Almost no training, unwelcoming to any feedback from employees. Large discrepancies between workloads, so just a few people are doing the majority of the work. Very little room for growth.

pros: MaineHealth values partnership and collaboration. Feedback is welcome from all levels of the organization.
cons: Like many organizations during and post Covid MaineHealth was staffing challenges.

pros: The corporation has made incremental pay raises
cons: The company needs to increase IT to support remote workers

pros: Very flexible with scheduling, fairly decent training
cons: Low pay, refuses to negotiate and doesn't consider your education level into your worth within the company

review_title: Great place to work and get experience in health education
pros: Great colleagues, good mentorship, encouraged by supervisors to explore new projects and get additional training to build skill-set. My time there gave me many skills future employers are looking for.
cons: Lots of time spent in meetings. Importance of health education not always valued by the rest of MaineHealth.

review_title: Not the best for your mental health
pros: Flex work; 3 days WFH and 2 in office; starts after completing 6 months in current position working full time in office. They are always hiring.
cons: Horrible pay; they do not value their employee’s’ talent; don’t prioritize mental health, employees are burned out but they still want one person to complete the task of 3. Employee turnover rate is through the roof. They will offer promotion with the least amount of pay increase but the workload increase is abnormally large. Many people turn down promotions for this reason.

pros: MaineHealth is innovative and leading the way to changing health care for Maine and New Hampshire communities. If you want to be a part of upstream prevention and value-based care, this is the place for you!
cons: Their benefits are severely lacking. There is no support for fertility treatment and negligible adoption assistance. Pay rates for mid-level employees (though high for a nonprofit) are low comparatively across the job market. Unfortunately, this supports a system that traps people into limited economic class growth, especially with no student loan support and limited tuition reimbursement.

pros: Excellent supervisors and technical staff. IT support is above average. Friendly work environment, most of the time! Good benefits. Plenty of hours... if that's what you want.
cons: Pressure to work extra shifts and overtime. Unable to retain support staff, partly due to compensation based on a signing bonus. A lot of short term employees with no loyalty.

job_title: ADA Accommodation Specialist in Portland, ME
pros: Flexibility and autonomy seemed universal amongst employees
cons: feast and famine work flow, little support to accomplish goals

pros: Tuition reimbursement is a plus

pros: Maine Health overall is a great company to work for. Many benefits and incentives to receive, rewards and benefits. Well organized and structured for consistent protocols.

job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Augusta, ME
pros: Some locations are rocking it out. The culture is spot on and you have leadership from executive level to the more intimate local level that believe in you and your team. Value you and your team. Promote, encourage,give you the tools and resources you need, teach, respect each and every one of us. If we have an issue or concern we can speak to anyone to get resolution. There is a collaborative approach to leadership and running of individual departments. People are vested and would go and do go above their individual roles to assist others. There is celebration of personal and professional achievements. There is gratitude from leadership executive and direct; additionally from like colleagues.
cons: NOT ALL LOCATIONS ARE CREATED EQUAL- You have leadership executive to local that is essentially cancer. Complete opposite of all the pros listed above. You should do your homework and find people who work at the site you would like to work at and ask tough questions before accepting a job. Don't be fooled. There are amazing sites and there are the others that make you question your sanity.

review_title: Could be a much better place to work....
pros: Fortunately for the patients there are many wonderful physicians, NPs, PAs, allied health professionals and others working here who care about delivering consistently safe, effective care and supporting each other. The work environment, on a personal level, is mostly friendly and supportive. If you are fortunate enough to have a good manager, your work life will be good. Some positions pay well for the area.
cons: Senior management is out of touch with reality and the struggles of employees at all levels. Very little common sense is shown in decision making. Bullying is condoned. Great variety of ability and professionalism among managers and supervisors. Many people are allowed to stay in jobs who are not productive or professional. Advancement only comes for those whose bosses are part of the inner circle. Pay raises stuck at 2% (or less) per year unless your boss is part of inner management circle.

pros: Aside from being gainfully employed and enjoying the company of my coworkers there are very few pros that come to mind.
cons: Southern Maine Medical Center recently had a consulting /efficiency firm visit the hospital to look for ways to save money.  The result was a significant amount of lay-offs and benefit reductions amongst other changes. There is very minimal opportunity for pay raises or bonuses. the max pay raise is 2% per year. The majority of these issues are a reflection of the financial state of the hospital due to outside factors but it does not change the fact that the cons far outweigh the pros.

review_title: Good Work Life Balance and Poor Pay and Benefits
pros: Work Life Balance is the main reason people stay. However, each department varies greatly in this aspect. Make sure to ask about it during an interview.
cons: The pay is on the lower end for the area and there are no salary increases beyond a very small cost of living increase each year.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT) in North Conway, NH
pros: Good benefits, lots of vacation time, cafeteria available for employees
cons: HR is NOT on your side. They side with the managers on any and every subject. If you are being harassed, sexually harassed or bullied by a manager they will not help. I saw this happen time and time again over the years. I left when it finally happened to me

pros: Great coworkers; no other pros.
cons: Poor management who are afraid of change.  Don't bother expressing your opinion if it differs from their ideas; you'd be wasting your breath.  Rehab employees are forced to treat conditions that they are not trained to treat, therefore potentially causing harm to patients.  PTO is being curbed, yet management continues to receive raises.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Portland, ME
pros: Hiring without any form of discrimination, adequate training, growth potential includes access to all jobs within a dynamic multi-tiered health care services provider.
cons: Open-access (Kaizen) call-room set-up is not for everyone. Growing pains include significant turnover in staff and management.

job_title: Staff Medical Technologist in Biddeford, ME
pros: good salary-- the department worked as a team,  you felt like a family- many opportunities to grow and they provided training all the way
cons: traffic getting to and from work could be difficult at times-- i traveled 45 mins to  work-  the summer is very busy, local hospital for many vacationers

pros: For the most part, warm, kind, and compassionate providers. People genuinely care about their patients. Lots of great people within the interpreting services department who were passionate about their work. Paid travel time. Paid for appointments even when the PT no-showed.
cons: Lack of communication. Would often show up at appointments only to learn that it had been cancelled days before.

pros: Great benefits, shift and weekend differentials. Plenty of earned time off. Honest, hard working co-workers who are always willing to help and make it fun
cons: Short staffed which in return staff can't get time off so they get burnt out and sick

review_title: Good place to experience  a wide range of technologies
pros:
Exposed to many different technologies
Chance to master several of them to improve worth to company
Paid training
cons: A few managers have their own idea of how you do a project, but they won't share with you until your project is completed.

pros:
Great work environment, Generous PTO, Sick leave, Maternity leave
Work/ home life balance, Health insurance, Dental insurance
You truly feel valued as an employee. Team activities monthly.
Company activities quarterly
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Insurance Follow Up Specialist (Patient Financial Services Associate) in Scarborough, ME
pros: Very good benefits. Staff will take any opportunity to eat cake.
cons: Production work means assembly line style collections. Ever changing and inconsistent job demands. Finger pointing culture. No windows. High turnover and low employee appreciation. Makes me feel disposable. Scolded for attempting to improve the process.

pros:
Great learning experience. 
Hands on learning with patients 
Learn how to take blood pressures and vital signs
cons:
I could not talk about nutrition or any other topic with patients other than exercise
I wish that I had a job there. They were only hiring per Diem

pros: Great opportunities, good location in Portland area.
cons: Pay lower than desired. Westbrook not as desirable as Portland downtown Free Street area.

job_title: Food Service Assistant in Scarborough, ME
pros: The company was a very good place to work for they had good pay good benefits and great people
cons: really don't have any. I left there to move to Tennessee

pros: Dedicated employees and an overall positive culture.
cons: Growing pains, slow to adapt new policies i.e. work from home.

pros: Stable industry, Great benefits and Intelligent people
cons: Some antiquated policies and having to shuttle in from offsite.

pros: Lots of great resouces due to the capability to collaborate with other analysts.
cons: It's a large company made of merged smaller locations. So information can be entity unique.

pros: Fellow Employees are fantastic and supportive.
cons: HR department is a bunch of fools and are defended by management because they find ways to constantly take hard earned money from you.  Red tape here....red tape there.

Unifying over a dozen hospitals in Maine and New Hampshire
Maine
cons:

pros: Co-workers are great, very supportive.
cons: Management on MS4 very poor, no follow through, lies, staff-splitter.  High turn-over

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Sanford, ME
pros: health benefits good, vacation time adequate, large company
cons: ,low wages, poor administration, work short staffed  a lot

job_title: Administrative Nurse Supervisor in Portland, ME
pros: Excellent patient and family advocates as well as strong commitment to employees.
cons: No cons, would work at Maine Health again.

job_title: Associate Technical Training Analyst in Portland, ME
pros: Benefits and  opportunities for growth
cons: Low pay comparatively, lack of action on sexual harassment, high burn out, low employee happiness

pros: They provided great benefits and a good work environment
cons: There was not much room for growth in this position

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Biddeford, ME
pros: Small, everyone knows everyone. Easy access to management and physicians
cons: there are not a lot of resources

job_title: Supply Chain Co-Op in Biddeford, ME
pros: Good Management style, Growth opportunity a lot
cons: None I can think of

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician in Norway, ME
pros: Equipment, pay, shifts, ski resort coverage
cons: Limited shifts, rural area, long commutes, bls drivers

pros: Community Focused, Cares about Maine
cons: Pay is well below market.

pros: Good benefits, somewhat flexible schedule
cons: Strict employment policies at MaineHealth
